li.a: Heart of Ohio Family Health Center @ WYHS

div.span: WCS 2020-2021 Intra-District Open Enrollment Now Available
The Whitehall City School District is now accepting the 2020-2021 intra-district open enrollment applications for elementary school students.
WCS on statewide school closure until May 1st
WCS will follow Governor DeWine's orders of a statewide school closure until Friday, May 1st (tentative). Read more for our FAQ page.
Helpful information for the new coronavirus or COVID-19

Our number one priority at Whitehall City Schools is child safety. We know you have many questions and concerns regarding the new coronavirus or COVID-19 and we want to help provide you with the most accurate and up-to-date information.
Heart of Ohio Family Health Center @ WYHS opens March 16th
Beginning on March 16, 2020, central Ohio-based Heart of Ohio Family Health will open Franklin County’s first school-based health center at Whitehall-Yearling High School (675 S. Yearling Rd.).

img.alt: Heart of Ohio Family Health logo

div.span: Take the US Census 2020
We are excited to announce that we’ve partnered with the U.S. Census Bureau to support the #2020Census! As a partner, we’ll be working to ensure that our community is accurately represented.
WCS Placed on the College Board's AP District Honor Roll
Whitehall City Schools is one of 250 school districts in the U.S. and Canada being honored by the College Board with placement on the 10th Annual AP® District Honor Roll.

img.alt: Teachers and staff pose with the College Board's AP District Honor Roll certificate

div.span: NEW student online enrollment portal now live
We’ve made enrolling your child and keeping their student records up-to-date easier than ever!

source.p: To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

div.span: The Whitehall City School District is now accepting the 2020-2021 intra-district open enrollment applications for elementary school students. Intra-district open enrollment is available to our parents of elementary school students Grades 2-5 who are interested in transferring their child to one of our other elementary schools (Beechwood or Etna Road) outside of their home school attendance boundary.
We created this page to answer some of the questions you had regarding the extended spring break. This situation is very fluid so these items can change.

a.title: WCS placed on the College Board's AP District Honor Roll

img.title: WCS placed on the College Board's AP District Honor Roll
img.alt: WCS placed on the College Board's AP District Honor Roll

h3.a: Whitehall City Schools Placed on the College Board’s 10th Annual AP® District Honor Roll

div.span: Whitehall City Schools is one of 250 school districts in the U.S. and Canada being honored by the College Board with placement on the 10th Annual AP® District Honor Roll. To be included on the 10th Annual Honor Roll, Whitehall City Schools had to, since 2017, increase the number of students participating in AP while also increasing or maintaining the percentage of students earning AP Exam scores of 3 or higher.

h3.a: Heart of Ohio Family Health Opens @ WYHS on March 16th

div.span: Caring for our students, parents, faculty, and the Whitehall community one heart at a time! All insurances and uninsured patients accepted.

There is a new philosophy that the Whitehall City Schools administration is employing with their teachers, staff, and students and it centers around the word ‘grit.’ You may have even seen some students wearing “RAM GRIT” t-shirts around Whitehall recently. Get used to it. Grit is a word that you’ll be hearing again and again from our school district.

a.title: NEW student online enrollment portal now live

img.title: NEW student online enrollment portal now live
img.alt: NEW student online enrollment portal now live

h3.a: NEW student online enrollment portal now live

div.span: Whitehall City Schools now has an even easier way to enroll your child and update their student information online.

Sealed bids will be received by Whitehall City Schools until 1:00 pm, local time, on Tuesday, March 10, 2020, at the Administration Building, 625 S. Yearling Road, Whitehall, Ohio 43213, and opened and read immediately thereafter for all labor, material, and services necessary for Pathways Program at Whitehall-Yearling High School, as described in the Contract Documents prepared by Schorr Architects, Inc. Direct all questions to Stacey Rose at (614) 798-2096 or srose@schorrarchitects.com.

The Whitehall City School District designates the following items as directory information: student name, address, date of birth, participation in officially recognized activities and sports, weight and height of members of athletic teams, and achievement awards and honors.
